key_insight: Spatia stores an explicit 3D point-cloud as persistent spatial memory and iteratively generates video clips conditioned on—and updates—that memory via visual SLAM, enabling much better long-term spatial and temporal consistency.
problem_solved: Existing video generation models lose geometric and temporal coherence over long sequences because they lack an updatable, persistent spatial representation of the scene.
method: Maintain a persistent 3D scene point cloud as spatial memory to capture static geometry and scene layout.
Iteratively generate short video clips conditioned on the current spatial memory to produce temporally coherent segments.
Continuously update the point-cloud memory with visual SLAM and dynamic–static disentanglement so future clips remain consistent with accumulated scene knowledge.
impact: Enables generation of longer, more coherent videos with stable object positions and geometry, reducing hallucinations and drift; easily integrates with existing generative pipelines to improve temporal and spatial fidelity.
